image.altText: Sharon Graham, Peter Koenig, Gregory Roser and Bruce Saunders.

items.synopsis: Sharon Graham has been found guilty of masterminding the so-called 'woodchipper murder' of the mild-mannered Bruce Saunders — a cash-poor but asset-rich man deemed to be worth more dead than alive.

title.children: The sinister web of sex and deception that led to a gruesome murder

image.altText: one rural firefighter sits in the passenger seat of a fire truck on a walkie-talkie, another drinks from a cooler nearby

items.synopsis: Authorities are investigating reports some residents near out-of-control bushfires in southern Queensland didn't receive emergency alerts telling them to leave.

title.children: More homes lost as authorities investigate reports some residents didn't receive emergency bushfire alerts

image.altText: A young woman holding flowers after graduating next to flowers and a tribute

items.synopsis: When 21-year-old Lilie James failed to return home from work on Wednesday, a welfare phone call led police to a tragic crime scene they found confronting.

title.children: Shock waves after suspected murder of 21-year-old Lilie James spotlights violence against women

image.altText: a woman in a wheelchair on the driveway of a home

items.synopsis: An NDIS policy designed to protect vulnerable Australians from being overcharged has had the unintended consequence of forcing people who live alone out of their homes in the middle of a housing crisis.

title.children: Amy to be forced out of NDIS-funded home during housing crisis because she doesn't want to share

image.altText: a multi-vehicle pile-up outside a shopping centre. a blue car is on its side leaning on the bonnet of a police car

items.synopsis: Four teenagers have been arrested after a crash involving a stolen car, where a police vehicle was allegedly rammed, while a man is feared dead in a separate incident on the Cunningham Highway.

title.children: Teens arrested after police car and other vehicles allegedly rammed, man feared dead in separate crash

image.altText: A woman stands next to some big leaves

items.synopsis: Brisbane City Council's deputy mayor has failed to substantiate her claim that Greens candidate Kath Angus is soft on crimes such as shoplifting and break-and-enters.

title.children: Brisbane LNP fails to back up accusations against Greens candidate

image.altText: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk wears a white jacket

items.synopsis: Queensland's premier insists she has learnt a lesson from a politically damaging few months, as Labor and the Liberal-National Party launch unofficial election campaigns a year out from polling day, writes Rachel Riga.

title.children: 'We could have done things differently': Annastacia Palaszczuk insists she has 'absolutely learnt' from a challenging 2023

image.altText: A boy cycles past "Lewiston strong" banners in Lewiston, Maine

items.synopsis: US authorities say a man suspected of fatally shooting 18 people and wounding 13 in the north-east state of Maine has been found dead following a 48-hour manhunt.

title.children: Maine mass shooting suspect found dead following 48-hour manhunt

image.altText: A doctor using a stethoscope on a patient.

items.synopsis: Urgent care clinics have been opened around Australia to help ease the pressure on hospital emergency departments — so where are they? When are they open? And do they bulk-bill?

title.children: Urgent care clinics — the new medical service designed to ease pressure on hospital EDs

image.altText: Sales standing in a dining room, smiling at camera.

items.synopsis: Recently, I've been one of the many Australians who are avoiding the news. What is going on, when the news is losing not just its regular audience, but alienating a career newshound like me, asks Leigh Sales.

title.children: When Leigh Sales stole Ita Buttrose's car park, she returned to a note on the windscreen

image.altText: A baby with a tube stuck to her face

items.synopsis: A music therapist's playlist for any given workday will be as varied as the patients they work with — they may start the day serenading a baby with Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star and end it playing a version of a heavy metal song to an adolescent.

title.children: Ten-week-old Ruby has spent most of her short life in hospital but music is helping her cope

image.altText: A fire vehicle backlit by an intense blaze

items.synopsis: After a rugged week, Queensland is facing up to a "generational fire season" the state hasn't experienced since the 1950s, according to the rural fire brigade chief.

title.children: 420 bushfires in days exhaust firefighters and 'worst fire season in 70 years' is just beginning

image.altText: A collage of buildings on Nauru, an eye with a tear, a woman holding a child and an unidentifiable security guard

items.synopsis: 'Simone' was the worker behind 'The Nauru Files' — the largest leak inside Australia's system of offshore detention. She's never spoken out to reveal why she did what she did — until now.

title.children: She's never spoken out before, but this woman leaked thousands of documents about our offshore detention system

image.altText: Broken Hill resident and subscriber to the Barrier Truth, Lyn Farquharson with archive photos of the newspaper

items.synopsis: When Broken Hill's Lyn Farquharson got a letter from her local newspaper about a new delivery fee, she was not impressed. She says she and other longtime readers deserve more for their loyalty.

title.children: 'Not everybody can go on a computer': Why this outback newspaper's new delivery fee has angered locals

image.altText: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken meets with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi.

items.synopsis: The first visit by a Chinese foreign minister to Washington since 2018 may help keep lines of communication open between the two geopolitical rivals.

title.children: Top US and Chinese diplomats pave way for Joe Biden and Xi Jinping summit

image.altText: Zak Grieve, wearing a prison ID tag, baseball cap and sunglasses around his neck, sits in front of a wall with art on it.

items.synopsis: The release of Zak Grieve triggers fresh debate over the Northern Territory’s controversial mandatory sentencing regime.

title.children: Zak Grieve’s release from prison puts NT’s mandatory sentencing laws back in spotlight

image.altText: young runner taking her mark on track field

items.synopsis: Young country athletes often face more hurdles than their city counterparts, but that may soon change.

title.children: When Demi's coach died, her country athletics team started training themselves

image.altText: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope captures the dance of interacting galaxies in Arp-Madore 2339-661 (NGC 7733, NGC 7734).

items.synopsis: The cosmic waltz captured by the ultra-powerful telescope took place roughly 500 million light years away from Earth.

title.children: Hubble telescope captures image of 'galactic dance'

image.altText: A black and white photo of a non-Indigenous man walking through a swamp with his bike near an Indigenous man with a spear.

items.synopsis: After riding 3,000 kilometres from Adelaide to Darwin in 1914, Ted Ryko was lauded as a hero. Then World War I broke out and facing harassment, he fled to Arnhem Land, where he would form a unique connection with Aboriginal people.

title.children: Accused of being a spy, world-record-breaking adventurer Ted Ryko found refuge in outback Aboriginal communities

image.altText: A woman sits in a light rail simulator cabin surrounded by other people

items.synopsis: Belgium's Princess Astrid commemorates the Australians who died in World War I while leading her country's first economic mission to Australia in more than a decade, as Australia and the European Union negotiate a free trade agreement.

title.children: Belgian princess honours Australian war dead while leading first trade mission since 2012

image.altText: Pills

items.synopsis:
Don't get it twisted, drug decriminalisation does not mean hard drugs are legal. Here's what you need to know about the ACT's new laws.

The change means people found with small amounts of illicit drugs will get a fine rather than a criminal penalty.

title.children: Canberra's nation-leading drug-decriminalisation laws begin today. So, what changes?

image.altText: A hand holding several cigarettes

items.synopsis: Police are stepping up their efforts to tackle the illegal tobacco market, after a string of arson attacks against shops in Victoria.

title.children: More than 30 arsons investigated as black market 'chop-chop' war heats up

image.altText: A woman and a man leaning against a bright yellow box filled with food attached to the outside of a building

items.synopsis: Community-led food pantry pop ups gaining popularity as people look to help their neighbours through cost-of-living crisis.

title.children: Pub-goers, pensioners join the frontline as 1 in 5 struggle to put food on the table

image.altText: A close up of Yahya Sinwa at a rally among a crowd of people.

items.synopsis: Twelve years ago, Yahya Sinwar was inside an Israeli jail cell with no means of escape. Now, Israel has accused the Hamas Gaza chief of playing a role in planning the October 7 attack, with officials calling him a "dead man walking".

title.children: This chief of Hamas in Gaza was once a prisoner of Israel. Now Yahya Sinwar is a 'dead man walking'

image.altText: Large explosion of orange lights up the skyline in gaza at night

items.synopsis: Israeli air and ground forces are stepping up operations in the Gaza Strip, Israel's chief military spokesperson says, amid reports of heavy bombing of the besieged enclave.

title.children: Phone and internet cut by heavy bombardment, with Israel 'expanding activities' in Gaza

image.altText: A man carrying a plastic shopping bag walks across rubble and destroyed buildings

items.synopsis: There is a disturbing lack of bipartisanship on the question of the Middle East, which has real world consequences and seems to potentially point to an ugly new direction in domestic politics, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: Comments from Australian leaders about the Middle East point to an ugly new direction for our political future

image.altText: Fijian Tongan woman stands holding a shell wearing latex gloves with historic pacific clothes hung behind her

items.synopsis: The gallery houses artefacts of deep cultural significance to the diaspora in Australia, including a rare 1,000-year-old replica Rotuman headdress.

title.children: Dive into Wansolmoana — 'one salt ocean' — Australia's new repository of Pacific culture and history

image.altText: An earthworm with a spiral like tip for burrowing into the soil

items.synopsis: Soil ecologist Frank Ashwood starting taking macro photographs of the life in UK soil as a COVID project. He has since come to Australia to see what is here.

title.children: Photographer captures beauty of tiny creatures that keep soil healthy

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou wraps an arm around Pedro Porro after a game

items.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou's Tottenham Hotspur open up a five-point lead at the top of the Premier League with a 2-1 victory at Crystal Palace as their unbeaten start to the season continues.

title.children: Postecoglou takes Spurs five points clear on top of the Premier League with Palace win

image.altText: A scrapbook of 12 mugshots, mostly women.

items.synopsis: A selection of 400 images from the State Library of NSW's vast collection — with one for nearly every year between 1845 and 2022 — will be on show for the first exhibition in its new photo gallery.

title.children: Australia's oldest photo and Ned Kelly's criminal record among rare images on display for first time
